variables.systemDescription: The Super Nintendo Entertainment System (also known as the Super NES, SNES, or Super Nintendo) is a 16-bit home video game console developed by Nintendo and released in 1990 in Japan, 1991 in North America, 1992 in Europe and Australasia (Oceania), and 1993 in South America. In Japan, the system is called the Super Famicom, officially adopting the abbreviated name of its predecessor, the Family Computer, or SFC for short. As an addition to fans have developed the MSU-1 chip, an unofficial expansion developed that allows the SNES to play CD-quality audio and full-motion video, significantly enhancing the console's multimedia capabilities.
